snippet: Public distrust created by last year’s nuclear disaster forced the nation to at least temporarily do without atomic power for the first time in 42 years.
abstract: Japan’s last operating reactor, which is located at the Tomari plant in Hokkaido, is shut down as the public distrust created by the 2011 nuclear disaster forces the nation to at least temporarily do without atomic power for the first time in 42 years.
lead_paragraph: Public distrust created by last year’s nuclear disaster forced the nation to at least temporarily do without atomic power for the first time in 42 years.

headline.main: Last Reactor of 50 in Japan Is Shut Down
headline.print_headline: Last Reactor Of 50 in Japan Is Shut Down
